avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. Dry avalanches can as before be released by small loads and reach large size in isolated cases, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the sometimes strong westerly wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m.
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall will be deposited on soft layers in all aspects above approximately 1500 m. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. Dry avalanches can as before be released by small loads and reach large size in isolated cases, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the sometimes strong southwesterly wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1400 m.
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: The fresh snow as well as the sometimes large wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall will be deposited on soft layers in all aspects above approximately 1500 m. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The sometimes deep wind slabs can still be released in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m.
In particular on very steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry and moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation.
Backcountry touring calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The moist fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming especially above approximately 2200 m can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 15 to 30 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2200 m. Up to 2000 m rain will fall until late morning in some regions. The weather conditions will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In particular steep shady slopes, above approximately 2200 m: Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

tendency.highlights: In some regions increase in danger of dry and wet avalanches as a consequence of new snow and strong wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed with care and prudence, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
As a consequence of the precipitation more frequent small and medium-sized dry and wet avalanches are to be expected in all altitude zones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dry and wet avalanches are to be expected during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. The wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed with care and prudence, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
As the temperature drops only isolated mostly small moist avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular on wind-loaded slopes above approximately 2200 m.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
